definition: strategically situated and easy to defend/strategic location
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: The remote location, strategically located and difficult terrain, Preah Vihear Temple is quite well preserved.
sentences.chinese: 由于地处偏远，地形险要，柏威夏寺保存得相当完好。

sentences.english: XuMaoShan is revealed that there is a dangerous mountain terrain.
sentences.chinese: 徐茂山则透露附近有一座地形险要的山头。

sentences.english: Caught between a rock and a hard place.
sentences.chinese: 在一块岩石和一个险要的地方之间被捉住了。

definition: to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
(to resist the enemy) relying on inaccessible territory
topography of a mountain/features of a mountain
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to hold a pass/to guard (a strategic location)
one man can hold the pass against ten thousand enemies (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 fu1 dang1 guan1 , wan4 fu1 mo4 kai1
